detractor: Please describe reason for low rating
happythankyoumessage: Thank you for taking your time out to provide your valuable inputs.
unhappythankyoumessage: Thank you for taking your time out to provide your valuable inputs.
name: Audit Name
identification_details: Has an alternative for the indwelling catheterization been considered and documented?
vital_signs: Is the patient confirmed using two identifiers?
surgery: Are the clinical reasons for insertion specified, communicated to the patient/bystander, and documented?
complaints_communicated: Has the need, possible complications, potential outcomes, and procedures been explained, and consent obtained from the patient/bystander by the performing staff?
intake: Did the person performing the procedure perform hand hygiene?
output: Is the person performing the procedure wearing PPE?
allergies: Does the person performing the procedure use sterile gloves?
medication: Is the catheterization kit available with a sterile catheter, sterile gloves, antiseptic solution, saline and syringe, dressing packs, scissors and forceps, lubricant, tray, and hand rub?
diagnostic: Is the smallest gauge of the catheter selected for effective drainage?
lab_results: Has perineal care been performed, and has hand hygiene been re-performed?
pending_investigation: Is the catheter lubricated with sterile lubricant?
medicine_order: Is aseptic technique maintained throughout the insertion, ensuring the appropriate length is inserted, and has hand hygiene been re-performed?
facility_communicated: Is urine allowed to drain before the catheter balloon is inflated?
risk_assessment: Is the catheter connected to a sterile drainage bag, placed safely below the level of the bladder, and has hand hygiene been re-performed?
urethral: Is urine flow checked, and is it ensured that there is no urethral trauma?
urine_sample: Is a urine sample sent to the laboratory, if required/advised, and has hand hygiene been re-performed?
bystander: Has the patient/bystander been educated regarding catheter care, the frequency of follow-ups, and has the procedure been documented?
